A4.text: He is sometimes seen as the first Impressionist composer, although he vigorously rejected the term.

A5.text: He completed the only opera he wrote, Pelléas et Mélisande.

A6.text: Claude Debussy and Maurice Ravel are two leading figures in Impressionism, though Debussy rejected this label

A7.text: The perception of Debussy’s compositional language as decidedly post-romantic/Impressionistic—nuanced, understated, and subtle—is firmly solidified among today’s musicians and well-informed audiences
